data.title: Draw the Striped Strip
data.statement:
A <<stripe>> is a continuous constant-width wide line (or wider) on a surface. 
A <<strip>> is a long thin piece by itself.

This puzzle is about a striped strip, where the strip is vertical and the stripes (on the strip) are horizontal.

The input is the [[recipe]] for the stripes (on the strip), in this format:
‣ 3-character-long chunks, separated by a space
‣ A chunk (for example) might be {{5!3}}, which means 5 rows of {{!}} followed by 3 rows of blank spaces

The width of the strip is always a quarter of its height.  (Rounding will never be required)

Draw the strip of stripes

data.stubGenerator:
read recipe:string(256)
write strip of stripes (in 4 to 1 ratio)
data.outputDescription: <<Multiple Lines: >> The rectangular strip of stripes

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A stripe is a continuous constant-width wide line (or wider) on a surface.
A strip is a long thin piece by itself.

This puzzle is about a striped strip, where the strip is vertical and the stripes (on the strip) are horizontal.

The input is the recipe for the stripes (on the strip), in this format:
‣ 3-character-long chunks, separated by a space
‣ A chunk (for example) might be 5!3, which means 5 rows of ! followed by 3 rows of blank spaces

The width of the strip is always a quarter of its height. (Rounding will never be required)

Draw the strip of stripes
Input
Line 1: A string, recipe
Output
Multiple Lines: The rectangular strip of stripes
Constraints
Example
Input
2a1 9b0
Output
aaa
aaa
   
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
bbb
